title: Atwater 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Seneca Lake)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot combines the sharp, herbal edges of Cabernet with the plumminess of Merlot to fine results. Umami notes of brine, mushroom and forest floor add savory complexity. It's a complex yet thoroughly approachable wine that's drinking elegantly now.

title: August Briggs 2012 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: A ripe, soft and well-integrated package of mountain fruit stars in this vineyard-designate, from a site high atop the Mayacamas Mountains that is famous for Zin. Spicy cinnamon spins itself through husky layers of black fruit and leather.

title: Dopff & Irion 2014 Riesling (Alsace)
description: Beautiful and appetizing notes of Cox Orange Pippin apples shine. The palate is zesty, sprightly and textured, and shows pure fruit—a combination that spells ideal refreshment. The lemony fillip on the finish is lip-smacking.

title: Firestone 2012 The Chairman Series Lineage Estate Grown Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Smoky black cherries, toasted oak, smoked meats, soy, iron and wild sage show on the nose of this top-level blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 17% Cabernet Franc, 17% Merlot, 17% Petit Verdot and 11% Malbec. It's both ripe and restrained on the palate, with blackberry fruit plus a line of licorice and pencil-lead minerality.
designation: The Chairman Series Lineage Estate Grown

title: Foxen 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried strawberries, plum and an iron character combine for a lush yet balanced nose on this entry-level bottling from the longtime Foxen Canyon winery. Condensed purple flowers, ripe olallieberries, turned earth and citrus peel show on the energetic palate.

title: Matchbook 2012 The Arsonist Red (California)
description: Harmony and a sense of reserve mark this rich but alarmingly named wine. It is deeply colored, smooth and supple in texture, and filled with satisfying but not too powerful flavors that are supported by fine-grained tannins. Lush blackberry and black cherry linger on the finish.

title: Meadowcroft 2012 Speedy Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Knights Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is a rich, expressive take on the Italian stalwart, fulsome and hearty in sizable tannins and yet exuberant in red and black fruit. A note of sage gives it a wild, herbal undertone before a long, flavorful finish.

title: Migration 2013 Split Rail Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: A light-gold color and toast, butterscotch and vanilla aromas lead to very rich, bold flavors of ripe pear, grilled baguette and melted butter. This wine is big and brassy, full bodied and intensely flavored. Dry, it's balanced by firm acidity that keeps it lively.

title: Mirabelle NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)
description: This bubbly from Schramsberg has a deepish, salmon color and peach, melon and ginger cookie aromas. It combines crispness and finesse, fruit with complexity. Hints of almond, walnut and subtle spices come out on the lingering finish.

title: JCB 2012 No. 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a massively dense, extracted and dry wine, entirely varietal and brooding in style. Tobacco and leather form its core, with the fruit elusive and pushed backward. Smoky oak penetrates the thick walls of tannin, forming a combustible, lengthy finish.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2014 Les Natures Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Ripe yellow plum and baked apricot make for a heady, aromatic opening. The palate holds this fruit in a rich frame with a rounded, opulent yet toned mouthfeel. Some residual sugar boosts the rich fruit even further, and the rich, oily texture is cut by citrus freshness

title: Market Vineyards 2011 Acquisition Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: High-toned baking spice, flower and herb aromas are backed by broad yet well-balanced dark-fruit flavors. The tannins are present but are polished to a fine sheen.

title: Market Vineyards 2011 Alpha Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: Coffee, dark chocolate, dark raspberry and spice aromas lead to full-bodied, palate-coating dark-fruit flavors backed by grainy tannins. The barrel influence rides high but it generally pulls it off.

title: Glasshaus 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Muddled at first, this wine comes around to reveal a strong, floral component of rose water and geranium, staying light and fresh on the palate, subtle yet flavorful. It finishes earthy in Asian spice.

title: Papapietro Perry 2012 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine features aromas that are fruity and spicy, but attractively earthy, too. Flavors resemble tart cherry, rhubarb and raspberry, without noticeable oak. Medium body and a lively but rounded texture make it easy to enjoy while its slightly lean profile makes it extra appetizing.

title: Signorello 2012 Estate Grown and Bottled Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This powerful wine that also holds 5% Cabernet Franc shyly packs a punch. At first it comes off as elegant, soft and highly approachable. Faint notions of blackberry and black cherry are highlighted amidst a concentrated, tannic build.

title: Peju 2011 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Given more time in bottle, this wine is blended with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon. A smokiness permeates the bouquet initially, before a more floral, violet perfume weighs in. Tannic and concentrated, the wine is also subtle in herb and tobacco, with a layering of cassis and raspberry.

title: Peñalolen 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Up front, this smells smoky and woody, although in due time earthy berry aromas emerge. This feels ripe and full in body; flavors of black cherry, cassis, fig and chocolate end with heady, toasty heat and a rich sense of extraction. Drink through 2018.

title: Patricius 2013 Sárga Muskotály Furmint (Tokaj)
description: Light straw to the eye, this dry Furmint has aromas of canned apricot and white flowers. It is rich on the palate, with flavors of canned peaches and Turkish delight.

title: Murphy-Goode 2012 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Perfumy, this lusty Zin is also structured and juicy, offering plenty of jammy blackberry and cherry to keep a palate coming back for more. Powerfully built, it'll stand up to chunks of meat very well.

title: Muscardini 2012 Alpicella Vineyard Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)
description: Fresh and dried, baked plum make their mark in this rustic, structured wine, the tannins firm and medium in size. Cherry and strawberry play in the background, along with a strong element of black licorice and herb, the overall experience calling out for food.

title: Napa Cellars 2013 V Collection Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fennel and spicy ginger account for much ado on the nose, before this medium-bodied wine exhibits well-integrated oak, baked apple and a hit of lemongrass on the palate. It finishes with a burst of spice.

title: Graziano 2012 Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: Great structure meets abundant fruit flavors in this big but well-balanced wine. The aromas are like Bing cherries and dark-roast coffee, while flavors recall dark chocolate and boysenberries. While obviously tannic and robust in texture, it seems to melt in the mouth for a smooth and lingering finish.

title: Proulx 2013 Jack Barrett Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's brilliant black cherry and blackberry richness on the nose of this blend of 10 grapes, from Syrah to Malbec to Touriga Nacional, as well as a mineral character of cold asphalt, clay and mud. The palate offers earthy and delicious flavors, with dried strawberry and olallieberry as well as black pepper and cappuccino.

title: Villa Annaberta 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: Sleek by Amarone standards, this opens with aromas of ripe black cherry, ground pepper, raisin and a whiff of blue flower. On the palate, finely woven tannins support raspberry jam, black pepper, cocoa and a cinnamon note.

title: Viña el Principal 2013 Calicanto Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Fleshy berry aromas are lush, inviting and surrounded by notes of shoe polish and violet petal. This is a Cabernet Sauvignon-led multigrape blend that's chunky on the palate. Bombastic plum, cherry and wild-berry flavors finish wide, with patented Chilean notes of olive and spicy oak. Drink through 2020.

title: Santa Cruz Mountain Vineyard 2012 Pierce Ranch Petite Sirah (San Antonio Valley)
description: As a counterpoint to fruit-driven takes on this historic California grape, this bottling shows the variety's shrubby side, with aromas of wild peppercorns, woody elderberries and olallieberries. Flavors are extremely earthy and restrained, with oregano, thyme and incense, proving quite elegant and never boisterous.

title: Sextant 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A rich umami character of smoked beef, freshly laid pavement and cola mixes with sour cherries and a light raspberry element on the nose of this wine. Flavors are quite dynamic, with a punchy strawberry-raspberry-sour cherry juice picking up complexity from a eucalyptus bite.

title: Stolpman 2013 L'Avion Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: Edges of lemon juice and plumeria flowers accent denser peach and sea salt aromas on this popular bottling from winemaker Sashi Moorman. He keeps this often dense grape light and playful, with flavors of lime sorbet, nectarine flesh, sea salt, white rocks and a nicely herbal twist of minty dill.

title: Oakville East 2012 Core Stone Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: With a slight preponderance of Cabernet Sauvignon to Cabernet Franc, this is a voluptuously smoky wine, rich in graham cracker, marshmallow and cedar. Moderate in oak and tannin, it brings full-bodied flavors to life slowly in the glass, finishing in leather and chocolate.
